organizations: U.S. House Committee on Oversight and Accountability

relationships.description: Chief Investment Officer of J.P. Morgan
Former owner of the Stratford Inn hotel
Former U.S. Senator who served 24 years

analysis.purpose: To provide market commentary and share George McGovern's perspective on business regulations and job growth
analysis.significance: Shows how a former liberal politician changed his views on business regulation after experiencing entrepreneurship firsthand during a recession

notable_quotes: "Wisdom too often never comes, and so one ought not to reject it merely because it comes late." - Justice Felix Frankfurter
"I'm tired of old men dreaming up wars for young men to fight" - George McGovern on the Senate floor
"one-size-fits-all rules for business ignore the reality of the market place" - George McGovern

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found. Document is a professional market commentary with political analysis.

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed. Document contains legitimate market analysis and political commentary.

details: References to Wall Street Journal publication
Reuters reporting on Al Gore's ethanol comments
General media commentary on economic issues

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be a publicly distributed market commentary from J.P. Morgan's investment office. George McGovern's Wall Street Journal article about his business experiences was publicly published. The economic analysis and political commentary would be of interest to financial media and policymakers.

analysis.summary: J.P. Morgan's Chief Investment Officer Michael Cembalest shares market commentary highlighting economic challenges and includes a notable article by former Senator George McGovern about his epiphany regarding business regulations after experiencing entrepreneurship firsthand with his Stratford Inn hotel during a recession.
